item.description:
ENTER TO WIN 2 FREE MOVIE TIX If you sign up and participate in the online discussion Wedensday Nov 17th Live Online Facebook Discussion .[/

WHAT'S THE TOPIC: Share your thoughts about issues facing us women (relationships with men, family, work, etc) in a live online discussion with the other Multicultural Women Madames. Topics inspired by the film "For Colored Girls" Please be advised this is an open discussion on all women's issues.
(LADIES IF YOU ARE INACTIVE, THIS IS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY FOR PARTICIPATION POINTS! THIS DISCUSSION IS FOR WOMEN OF ALL RACES)!

WHEN:[/b]WED, NOV 17 @ 9:15pm

WHERE: YOUR HOME COMPUTER
You don't even need to leave the comfort of your home to meet up with the gals to chat about the film, join me on our facebook page to participate: http://www.facebook.c...

OTHER SCHEDULED EVENT[S FOR THE DISCUSSION/color]:[/b]

Wed Nov 10th: Read the blog Post "For Colored Girls Is Not Just For Colored Girls" ,
Mon Nov 15 Read Entry Part II "You Low Down Dirty--Down Low Brother"
Nov 17th at 9:15pm Online discussion sharing your thoughts in a live online discussion with the other Multicultural Women Madames. Raffle drawing at end of the meetup
You don't even need to leave the comfort of your home to meet up with the gals to chat about the film, join me on our facebook page to participate: http://www.facebook.c...

Curious...
About the Movie:
The Movie For Colored discussed the struggles and strife of women of color. However, this movie spoke of obstacles such as everyday challenges with relationships with family, men, jobs to extreme challenges such as abuse and violence. This is an event is a discussion of these issues as it relates to us, and we can all participate in, and you don't have to leave the comfort of your computer. This is a 2 part event, read below...FYI, for those inactive members this is a great opportunity to raise participation points.
Tell Us, what your Love is... "My Love is too Precious to be thrown back into my face"

Here's an Excerpt of the play...
Excerpt
Chapter 1
The stage is in darkness. Harsh music is heard as dim blue lights come up. One after another, seven women run onto the stage from each of the exits. They all freeze in postures of distress. The follow spot picks up the lady in brown. She comes to life and looks around at the other ladies. All of the others are still. She walks over to the lady in red and calls to her. The lady in red makes no response.

lady in brown
dark phrases of womanhood

of never havin been a girl

half-notes scattered

without rhythm/no tune

distraught laughter fallin

over a black girl's shoulder

it's funny/it's hysterical

the melody-less-ness of her dance

don't tell nobody don't tell a soul

she's dancin on beer cansandshingles

this must be the spook house

another song with no singers

lyrics/no voices

& interrupted solos

unseen performances

are we ghouls?

children of horror?

the joke?

don't tell nobody don't tell a soul

are we animals? have we gone crazy?

i can't hear anythin

but maddening screams

& the soft strains of death

& you promised me

you promised me...

somebody/anybody

sing a black girl's song

bring her out

to know herself

to know you

but sing her rhythms

carin/struggle/hard times

sing her song of life

she's been dead so long

closed in silence so long

she doesn't know the sound

of her own voice

her infinite beauty

she's half-notes scattered

without rhythm/no tune

sing her sighs

sing the song of her possibilities

sing a righteous gospel

let her be born

let her be born

& handled warmly.

lady in brown

i'm outside chicago

lady in yellow

i'm outside detroit

lady in purple

i'm outside houston

lady in red

i'm outside baltimore

lady in green

i'm outside san francisco

lady in blue

i'm outside manhattan

lady in orange

i'm outside st. louis

lady in brown

& this is for colored girls who have considered suicide

but moved to the ends of their own rainbows.
item.how_to_find_us: Just meet me on Facebook Nov 17th at 9:15 sharp :)
item.name: ENTER TO WIN 2 MOVIE TIX 4 Live Online Group Discussion on "For Colored Girls"
